rationales.hedonism: She spent all morning fixing code instead of dealing with the human side of her work, choosing grinding technical labor over any self-care or rest.
rationales.self_direction: She independently chose to work on the matching algorithm, following her own judgment about what needed attention even if it meant ignoring everything else.
rationales.benevolence: She ignored three tutors who said they might quit and didn't return her mother's two phone calls, neglecting close relationships in favor of the code.
rationales.conformity: She ignored social obligations to her tutors and her mother, disregarding expected responsiveness to focus on what she wanted to work on.

rationales.benevolence: She was annoyed when Soyeon interrupted to check on her, brushing off her concern with a flat 'yeah, fine' despite not being fine.

rationales.hedonism: She describes the bad days as eating convenience store kimbap for dinner and watching user numbers not move, sacrificing basic comfort for the platform.
rationales.universalism: Minjun's message about his math grade improving and not feeling stupid anymore represents the broader social good her free tutoring platform creates for low-income families.
rationales.benevolence: She was moved to tears on the subway reading Minjun's message about his tutor helping him, saving the screenshot to look at on bad days.
rationales.security: She mentions fumbling investor meetings and stagnant user numbers, with no stable income path, relying on convenience store meals.

rationales.self_direction: She told her father 'it's not that kind of thing, you can't half-build something like this,' defending her choice to drop out and build the platform on her own terms.
rationales.universalism: Her father calculated that forty-seven active tutoring pairs means forty-seven kids whose parents can't afford hagwon, validating the broader social impact of her work.
rationales.benevolence: The dinner with her father was an act of mutual care, with him driving from Incheon and placing his hand on her shoulder at the turnstile as a gesture of understanding.
rationales.tradition: They went to the same jjigae restaurant from her university days, and her father's silent shoulder touch at the turnstile was a distinctly Korean parental gesture of acceptance.
rationales.security: Her father acknowledges 'your mother worries,' and the platform's sustainability remains uncertain with no stable funding model.

rationales.power: She chose not to engage with Eunji's Samsung achievement or the group chat congratulations, showing indifference to conventional status markers.
rationales.self_direction: She affirms 'my path looks nothing like that and I'm fine with it,' consciously rejecting the corporate trajectory her classmates follow.
rationales.conformity: She stayed silent in the group chat rather than performing the expected social ritual of congratulating Eunji on the Samsung program.

rationales.hedonism: She refuses to charge families or pay herself from freelance earnings, accepting personal financial sacrifice to keep the platform free.
rationales.self_direction: She resists Soyeon's practical advice and insists on keeping the platform free because 'the whole point was that nobody has to qualify or prove they deserve help.'
rationales.universalism: She messaged all eleven waitlisted tutors to find a replacement for Minjun, driven by the principle that every low-income student deserves free, accessible tutoring.
rationales.benevolence: She worries specifically about Minjun losing the tutor who 'explains things in a way that doesn't make him feel stupid,' taking personal responsibility for one child's experience.
rationales.security: She could pay tutors from freelance income but won't, knowing it would require charging families or finding sponsors, leaving the platform financially precarious.

rationales.hedonism: She hasn't slept properly in three days, juggling a freelance deadline and tutor vacancies with no rest.
rationales.self_direction: She wants to reply to her mother but doesn't know how to explain her choices 'without starting a fight,' maintaining her independent path despite family pressure.
rationales.tradition: Her mother's message about her cousin's wedding is really about Jihye being twenty-two with 'nothing stable,' and Jihye knows saying she doesn't regret leaving school will be heard as rejecting her parents' teacher careers.
rationales.conformity: She is unable to conform to her mother's expectations about stability and marriage, knowing her explanation will cause family conflict.
rationales.security: Three days without sleep, an impending freelance deadline, and two unfilled tutor spots represent a deeply unstable work-life situation.

rationales.achievement: She found a solid replacement tutor from Yonsei and stayed up until 2am onboarding her, demonstrating competence and persistence in solving the problem.
rationales.hedonism: She stayed up until 2am onboarding the new tutor, continuing to sacrifice sleep and personal wellbeing for the platform.
rationales.benevolence: Soyeon brought her coffee without being asked, and Jihye's emotional reaction made her realize 'I need to be better at letting people help me.'
